SDG_GOAL: Objective 6. Guarantee access for all to sustainably managed water supply and sanitation services
SDG_TARGET: 6.b Support and strengthen the participation of the local population in improving water and sanitation management
SDG_INDICATOR: 6.b.1.Proportion of local governments that have operational policies and procedures in place that encourage the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management
STAT_CONC_DEF: Workforce of local administrations with policies and operational procedures in place encouraging the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management in relation to the total workforce
COLL_METHOD: Data is collected daily from the MHEM
COMPILING_ORG: The MHEM statistical service is responsible for compiling the data for the calculation of this indicator at the national level.
INST_MANDATE: ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
RATIONALE: The indicator is relevant because it reports on the level of adherence of local administrations to operational policies and procedures encouraging the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management
REC_USE_LIM: The increase in this proportion will be conditioned by an increased awareness of local administrations
DATA_COMP: Workforce of local administrations that have policies and operational procedures in place to encourage the participation of the local population in water and sanitation management in relation to the total workforce
DATA_VALIDATION: Administrative data are validated by the technical committee for statistical information (CTIS)
COVERAGE: The indicator is available at national level
COMPARABILITY: The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
OTHER_DOC: Annual report of the Ministry of Hydraulics, Energy and Mines (REGIDESO and AHAMR)
